text: By the Bronze Age drinkingvessels were being made of sheet metal, primarily bronze or gold. However, the peak offeasting and in particular of the “political” type of feast came in the late Hallstatt period, soon after the foundation of the Greekcolonyof Massalia at the mouth of Rhine. From the date on the blood of the grape began to make its way north and east along major river systems together with imported metal and ceramic drinking vessels from the Greek world.
